definition: scattered/loose/to come loose/to fall apart/leisurely/powdered medicine
to scatter/to break up (a meeting etc)/to disperse/to disseminate/to dispel/(coll.) to sack

sentences.english: At the end of  the war the regiment disbanded.
sentences.chinese: 这个团于战争结束时被遣散了。

sentences.english: If so, severance payments may be provided if your employment is terminated.
sentences.chinese: 如果是这样，在你被开除的时候便会有遣散费。

sentences.english: An increasing number of people sttechnique to rewisize thmight educ is not complete with grlistingu.
sentences.chinese: 越来越多的人起先认识到教育不能随着毕业而遣散。

sentences.english: Find out about unemployment insurance, health insurance, pension benefits and severance pay.
sentences.chinese: 看看有样的失业保险，健康保险，退休金福利遣散费。

sentences.english: After the war the soldiers were demobilised.
Kastberg says the agreement aims at demobilizing child soldiers.
sentences.chinese: 凯斯特伯格表示，该协议旨在遣散儿童兵。

sentences.english: They ordered photographers to delete all the photos and then released them after criticism.
sentences.chinese: 警方责令摄影者删除照片，并进行批评教育将其遣散。

sentences.english: The editorial department disbands , Huang Tao has been shut in the cowshed.
sentences.chinese: 编辑部被遣散，黄涛被关进了“牛棚”。

sentences.english: They disbanded an army at the close of the war.
sentences.chinese: 战争结束时他们遣散了军队。

sentences.english: We do not accept that UNITA has no more troops to demobilize .
sentences.chinese: 我们不接受安盟再无军队要遣散的说法。

definition: to incorporate into one's troops/to weave in
to stay behind to take care of things
to detain/to take into custody/to imprison temporarily
to dismiss (from a post)/to expel from school/to order away (servants etc)
to provide a place to stay/to house/to accommodate/(of an institution etc) to take in/to accept
